alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 26 at 7:00PM CST until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Scott and Clinton Counties. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Henry IL, Whiteside and Rock Island Counties. Rock River at Moline affecting Henry IL and Rock Island Counties. .Expected heavy rainfall tonight and early Monday is expected to bring flooding to the Wapsipinicon and Rock Rivers. At this time, the exact amount of rain and runoff is not certain. These watches will likely become more specific warnings later on Monday. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River at Moline. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. In Moline, water affects homes on South Shore Drive and cuts off access to homes east of the I-74 bridge. Water also affects 49th Avenue south of the theater. Water affects Vandruff Island. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 PM CST Sunday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
